DataElement.preferredName: EQ-5D-5L Questionnaire Washing or Dressing Self-Care Today Status 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of their health state today as related to self-care (washing and dressing), using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: European Quality of Life Five Dimension Five Level Questionnaire Washing or Dressing Self-Care Today Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale which is used as a measure of health outcome. This instrument is a descriptive system consisting of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 5 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient._A question about an individual's current self-care ability with washing or dressing._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale which is used as a measure of health outcome. This instrument is a descriptive system consisting of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 5 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient.

Concepts.longName: European Quality of Life Five Dimension Five Level Scale Questionnaire

This instrument is a descriptive system consisting of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 5 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A five point ordered reference standard that describes current health state related to washing and dressing self-care using the EQ-5D-5L questionnaire.

PermissibleValues.value: I am unable to wash or dress myself

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is unable to wash or dress their self.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is unable to wash or dress their self.

PermissibleValues.value: I have moderate problems washing or dressing myself
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Moderate Problems with Washing or Dressing

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Moderate Problems with Washing or Dressing
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had moderate problems with washing or dressing.

Concepts.longName: Moderate Problems with Washing or Dressing
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had moderate problems with washing or dressing.

PermissibleValues.value: I have no problems washing or dressing myself

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no problems with self-care.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no problems with self-care.

PermissibleValues.value: I have severe problems washing or dressing myself
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Severe Problems with Washing or Dressing

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had severe problems with washing or dressing.

Concepts.longName: Severe Problems with Washing or Dressing
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had severe problems with washing or dressing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had slight problems with washing or dressing.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had slight problems with washing or dressing.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Medidata ePRO CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This CDE has been validated for use with the Medidata Rave ePRO module.
